name: Casita Blanca Condos

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Casita Blanca in late May/early June with another couple and we will back! We rented A4 (found it on VRBO.com) on the second floor of the building closest to the beach and pool and hated to leave. The 2 BR 2 bath unit was perfect for four people and Roberto and Selene were wonderful hosts. The view is fantastic and we spent most of the time on the veranda or in the clear water swimming, snorkeling or just lounging. We enjoyed the walk on the beach to town (10 minutes+), of course we usually had to stop at Sarah's Beach (sp?) Bar (100' away) or Ojo de Agua (5 minutes). If you want something in the condo before you get there (we wanted tequila, ice and red wine) Roberto and Selene will be happy to accomodate you. Definately recommended
reviews.title: The Real Mexico

reviews.text: Casita Blanca is a quiet and charming collection of condos right on the beach in Puerto Morelos. I stayed in Casita De Arte, which I am convinced is the best unit, as the view was extraordinary! I woke every morning to a view of the crystalline Caribbean sea. The view of the pool, just steps from the porch, also added to the experience. All around the beautiful and meticulously maintained grounds, there are coconut trees, flowering plants and bushes, and overhead, exotic pelicans fly. It feels unreal, so be prepared for it to take a few days for it to sink in that you are not dreaming. Inside the unit, it is very tastefully decorated, as art abounds. If you appreciate fine art, this is the place for you. The unit sleeps six comfortably, so it was more than enough space for my friend and I. Though there is a kitchen with all the amenities, we found the local food so delicious and reasonably priced, we just decided not to cook. Day trips to Playa Del Carmen, Cozumel and to Mayan Ruins are easily doable, even for the not-so seasoned traveler, because there are a number of kiosks in town that offer 'packages' to various attractions. The oddest part is that I lost 5 pounds on this vacation from all the swimming, and walking to town...which can be done by way of beach, or on the street. Either way, the walk is neither too long, or too short. Hey-- this is paradise, what do you expect?
reviews.title: Paradise On A Shoe String

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casita Blanca is situated on a quiet beach with swimming pool. It is run by Roberto and Selene who are most helpful and enjoyable to know. It was very good to be able to cook our own meals yet be able to walk to town restauuants. We would highly recommend this affordable luxury to everyone.
reviews.title: We found this place to be very friendly and beautifully situated

reviews.text: We just returned from a great stay at Casita Blanca. It was our 4th time staying in Puerto Morelos, but the 1st time at Casita Blanca. I loved the condo, but the location was just as great. Really nice beach right in front, much better than a lot of the areas further north. I hate the turtle grass, and in front of Casita Blanca there is a large area that is grass free and great for swimming. Roberto and his wife are the property managers and they were easy to find if we had a qustion. We had another couple with us and the also loved the condos and the location. We will be back!
reviews.title: Great condo and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Casita Blanca in unit B3 for 5 nights, November 29th to December 4th. We absolutely loved it there. It was an easy walk to town either on the street or down the beach. There are so many restaurants to choose from in town that you never have to eat at the same place twice. Our room was cleaned once while we were there. There were some things of value that were left out and nothing was touched. We felt very safe here. We really liked going to the town square in the evening and just people watch and enjoying the beautiful weather. The view from our balcony was exactly as shown on VRBO.com. The last morning we were there we saw a gorgeous sunrise. It looks out over the pool then right onto the beach. A pool is usually a must for me when on vacation, but we never used it. We cooled off by swimming and snorkeling in the ocean. There is a lot of seaweed that washes up on the beach, but a tractor came by every morning and cleaned it up. My fiancé had a lot of fun snorkeling right from the beach even though there is not a lot to see. He did find some great shells and sand dollars on one of his snorkeling ventures. There is a little bar right on the beach, just south of the property, that was open most days. Roberto was very nice. He helped us take our luggage up to our condo when we arrived…this was very much appreciated after a long night of travel. He also gave us suggestions of good places to eat. This is the type of place we like to stay when on vacation. We stayed the 2nd half of our vacation in Cancun at the Ritz Carlton. Our PM part of the vacation was much more relaxing and we felt much more comfortable in PM.
reviews.title: You will not be disappointed!

likes.disliked: — hard bed, ants and no hair dryer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One year later and a different condo unit – but still another great vacation. We stayed on the first floor again, a 2 bedroom condo this time, Unit A2. It was a very simple condo unit but with some funky and cool art work. We loved the view in the morning and the easy access from the first floor to the pool/beach. There is free wireless to stay connected if you so choose. Just a tip - if you are seeking a non-kid place, this is not the place for you. There is always a kid or two in the pool but a nice mixture of couples, families and seniors. We like the Casita Blanca condos so much we are actually looking to buy a unit if the right one opens up.
reviews.title: Another Repeat Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently returned from our fourth stay at Casita Blanca. We always book a room on an upper floor, because we love to watch the sea and the birds and the changing light. One of the very wonderful things about the place is the people who keep returning. We've made two wonderful friends and now try to plan our visits around theirs.
reviews.title: As always, just what we wanted and needed

reviews.text: Our stay at Casita Blanca was better than we could have ever imagined. Roberto and Selene are top-notch people and manage the property with a professionalism and caring rarely seen elsewhere. Part of our party did not arrive until five days later than planned due to the weather and, really needing a vacation by then, thought they would stay in a hotel after the rest of us left. Going to see an all-inclusive nearby, they decided to extend their stay (luckily the place was available) at Casita Blanca. PM is a wonderful town quiet but with everything you would need - walking there on the beach for lunch was a highlight of our grandsons' day (ages 3, 4 and 5). The restaurants are great - watching the kids play soccer in the square was another late afternoon activity for the little ones.
reviews.title: What a Gem
paradise - this is a great place to stay
reviews.text: I have been staying at Casita Blanca condos since they were first built. The location and ambiance are fantastic. Roberto, the manager, and his wife are great - so friendly and so helpful. I will continue to return to this great place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No more all-inclusive resorts for us! At Casita Blanca, we woke up with the sun, had our morning coffee overlooking the beach, and enjoyed every minute of our week in this quiet, laid-back setting. Our condo unit was bright and homey, the bed was very comfortable, and we were just steps away from the wide, sugar-soft beach. Roberto, the property manager, was welcoming, cheerful, and helpful. This would not be the right place for people who need night life, organized activities, or an endless supply of flufffy towels -- but for us, it was idyllic. We'd go back in a heartbeat. Email me with any questions, or for photos.
reviews.title: Beachfront gem

reviews.text: The super for the property, Roberto, is friendly and helpful. Unit a bit tired but still good value. Nice beach / water view. Nice warm pool. Strong value.
reviews.title: Solid Beachfront Value

reviews.text: I just returned from an 11 night stay at Casita Blanca. We stayed in B2 and there were two of us for the entire time and four of us for 5 nights. We learned about Puerto Morelos after reading an article in the New York times. We were looking for a relaxing beach vacation and were intrigued by what we read in the paper. Puerto Morelos is great if you're looking to avoid the crowds in Cancun and Playa del Carmen. We rented bikes and cruised around the small town checking out all of the restaurants. Puerto Morelos offers great snorkeling on the reef and it's easy to find guided tours to the nearby cenotes and Mayan ruins. There is not a huge nightlife in P.M., but if you're looking for relaxation and good food, this is the place!
reviews.title: Most relaxing vacation of my life

reviews.text: The pool at Casita Blanca is gorgeous and the beach is just steps away. It's about 100 yards away from Sarah's bar, the inspiration behind our trip. It's a great place to enjoy an afternoon cocktail and people watch on Sundays, the one day where the beach is packed with Mexican families. During the week, the beach is pretty desolate but soft and beautiful. The accommodations in our condo were not fancy, but it was clean and had everything that we needed. The grounds are beautifully maintained and they clean the place every 4 days. It's a great value and a great place to relax. I hope to return to Puerto Morelos and Casita Blanca again next summer.
reviews.title: Home on the beach

reviews.text: I have stayed in this wonderful apartment on numerous occasions, and it has always felt like a perfect home base for me in Mexico. The staff are extremely kind, helpful and friendly, and the apartments are all gorgeous. I usually stay in A2, and i have always had a wonderful experience there. When i think back to casita blanca, i feel the wind blowing through the open screen door and the cool stone floor under my bare feet and i see the bright sky competing with the ocean for blueness. I taste mangos and avocados, i smell the salty tang of the sea in the air, but also on my hair and my skin. Often i wake up in the soft, quiet haze of the pre-dawn, when the beach is empty and the breeze that continuously sings is almost still. Slowly the golden-red orb of the sun spills onto the watery horizon and i am joined on the beach by the occasional morning jogger or solitary woman practicing yoga or tai-chi on the sands or in the gazebo at the end of the dock.
reviews.title: A little bit of paradise

reviews.text: Later, as the morning progresses, families of locals and foreigners alike find themselves a spot to prop their umbrellas, settle their coolers and launch their kites. kids run down the beach, tumble in the carribean surf and call out with happiness. Their parents swim length in the brine, or walk lengths on the white sand, or read large chunks of their summer books.
reviews.title: Un otro dia en paraiso...

reviews.text: You will enjoy your stay in this beautiful and quiet location. The rooms are bright, well furnished and exceptionally clean. The staff is super helpful and friendly. The beach is fantastic, plus excellent snorkeling is just a ten minute walk down the beach.
reviews.title: Highly recommend Casita Blanca in Puerto morelos

reviews.text: Stayed hear for 2 weeks, great central location for excursions, fabulous accomodations. This complex is extremely clean and well managed. Roberto, the manager is helpful courteous and freindly. The 2 bedroom unit we stayed in (A1) was spacious and well kept. A/C worked great and located steps from the surf was just as much fun when we stayed home and played in the pool or on the beach as we did going to the many available exciting touring possiblilities
reviews.title: Could not be happier!!!

reviews.text: Roberto helped us set up a cook and daily housekeeping at very reasonable costs. On the days we were not having a cook could not find a bad meal in town. Especially recommend Coyote restaurant and the ice cream store at the town square has fantastic coconut ice cream!
reviews.title: Magical relaxing family vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just reutrned from a weeks' vacation at Casita Blanca (unit A2) in Puerto Morelos and are already planning our next trip. Casita Blanca is a small complex and everone we met there was very friendly and as happy with the place as we were. The bottom floor unit we stayed in was clean, comfortable, and was only feet away from the beautiful pool with a spectacular view out over the beach to the sea. It was perfect for us, our 4 year old and infant. The condo owner, Lynn, was a pleasure to deal with. The onsite managers, Roberto & Seline, were wonderful people who always went out of their way to make our stay most comfortable. There is a beautiful little beach bar next door. Puerto Morelos village is a word away from Cancun or Playa; much smaller, quieter, more relaxed, but still has a number of small shops and nice restaurants. Travel by bus to Playa or Cancun is easy and cheap. Our condo was excellent value for money. We highly recommend it.
reviews.title: The most relaxing vacation ever

reviews.text: We stayed for a week at Casita Blanca in a two bedroom ocean front condo on the second floor. The view alone was worth it , but it also was a very quiet and pristine setting. The condo was clean, everything we needed was there and Roberto, the manager, welcomed us and was always available for any questions we had.
reviews.title: perfection in mexico

aka: Casita Blanca Condos Hotel Puerto Morelos
description: Casita Blanca Condos in Puerto Morelos, the best place to relax in our 1 or 2 bedroom beachfront condos, we are in the northern part of Puerto Morelos, just a 1/2 mile walk from the main square, you can also enjoy our pool, or just have a tan in or pool or beach lounge chairs.
